intro: Dinacria filiformis, commonly known as the slender glassworts, is a member of the Amaranthaceae family. It is a halophyte, meaning it thrives in saline environments such as coastal areas and salt marshes. The plant has thin, cylindrical stems that are often covered in a layer of salt crystals, giving it a glassy appearance. Its leaves are typically small, scale-like, and arranged closely along the stem. Dinacria filiformis plays an important ecological role in stabilizing coastal soils and providing habitat for various small organisms.
